p: Among the low-cost base catalysts is the waste wood ash (WWA), this is a fine powder that is a byproduct of combustion of wood such as burning wood in a home fireplace or an industrial power plant. Researchers have revealed that the major components of the waste wood ash are calcium carbonate (CaCO3) [15], some find no carbonate but calcium oxide (CaO) [16], some show the presence of about 12% iron oxide due to soil contamination while some show none [17]. However, because of its availability, environmental pollution effects, non-weather resistance, unsuitability for polishing, and brittle structure, it is considered as base-feedstock for biodiesel synthesis from seed oil.
